intro: Calliphyllon palustre, commonly known as the marsh bellflower, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marsh environments in Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense clusters along the edges of ponds and streams. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence, while its stems are often reddish in color. Calliphyllon palustre is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
